ygData.subject: Re: HEY ZARDUS!!!!
ygData.msgSnippet: Diamond:: Yeah,well, the old cuffs and things worked well.  But a bot could get out of them.  IF one knew how, one could break the connection permenantly.

Diamond::

"Yeah,well, the old cuffs and things worked well.  But a bot could 
get out of them.  IF one knew how, one could break the connection 
permenantly. Thus become free from them."  
She looked at the ground as she remembered when she found the way to 
break her link and become free.  That was a few months before the 
council even realized she was no longer in thier control.
"Yeah,  the cuffs and other devices were good, but not fool proof."
She smiled slightly, thinking, this fool beat out a fool proof system.
"You said you use chips now? Things must have advanced since I left 
home."

She stood up and walked over to the machine,"So what will this thing 
tell us about that necklace?"






--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::DevilDuer::
> 
> DevilDuer's eyes follow Diamond's as she looks down at her wrists, 
> the Alliance bot noticing the cuffs. He looks back up as she covers 
> them by folding her arms, his gaze locking on the machine's screen 
as 
> he thinks over her words. He'd have to watch her.
> 
> "Hmm," he says, glancing at her, not acting any different than he 
was 
> before he noticed the cuffs, or at least not showing outside, "I 
> found it better to make a small chip and plug it into their head. 
> Easier that way, all the neural connections are closer. Mine warped 
> the bot's mind untill they wanted to do as I say, but most of the 
> bots on this planet are far too advanced for the old design."
